title: Is it advisable to study for CA at the age of 24? - Quora

response.answer_text: At the age of 24 according to you are you passionate about the degree that matters rather than thinking about the age. Before thinking about Ca I hope you have some purpose behind the degree and yes the challenges are double as at the time when people get settled in the lives you are thinking about. Nothing is wrong , nothing is right Only when you do things you realise the importance. If you wish and you have any back up plan for your career then you can do it and also aim to get a rank . Having a degree of Ca after 5 years will gain you a lot I suppose and plus you will be an inspiration for all the people who run away at the age of 24 . All the best Keep it up “Risk takers are best enterprenures”

I know this man, who is 45 years old and pursuing CA at this age. Reason: Passion. He really want the prefix C.A before his name. So, the question arises: “Are you passionate about it?”, “Do you really want to be a chartered accountant?”, “Is this your dream?”. If the answer is yes, go ahead. If the answer is no, please evaluate your other option as well. Do what is best for you. Age is just a number. Because when you will be a C.A. No one will ask your age. People will ask for your sign, People will ask for your valuable opinions.
